raw_response:
The Tunisian Jewish Djerban dish called "pizza" visually resembles a small oval or oblong bread loaf, often sliced and served warm, reflecting its origin as a kind of flatbread or bread roll rather than the typical Italian pizza pie[1]. The texture is solid and bread-like rather than soupy or stew-like. It has a crusty exterior with a soft interior, typical of bread made from leftover dough.

When served, this pizza is usually presented on a plate or platter, often sliced into portions suitable
